page.title: 102259 SOUTH BANK WOOD AREA
page.content: {LANDSCAPE:}Primary cover is 75% woodland;mainly deciduous(wide variety due to Sir George Clerk's being one of the first landowners in Scotland in the 18th century to plant trees)with breaks of mature conifers.Secondary cover is farmland;mainly intensively managed grassland and some ploughed land.{INLAND WATER:}The River N.Esk flows from S.W.to E.{RESIDENTIAL:}On the northern boundary is the Spear Gate Lodge,gatehouse to Penicuik Estate.Built in 1874,it is presently occupied by semi-retired estate workers.{BUILDINGS:}Tower-shaped dovecot built in 1750 is now only used as a flag tower.{COMMUNICATIONS:}The television mast built in 1962 is still in use.Formerly used to pick up television signals for parts of Penicuik but now used by Police and Gas Board in case of riot or gas leak.
